chapter.title: Array Type
chapter.clause: Constraints Given the array-type [T;N] and a slice-type [T], N shall be a potentially-dependant constant expression of type usize, and T: core::marker::Sized traits.sized.
An array type, declared [T;N], is a special compound type, dependant on T. It has N values of type T laid out contiguously in increasing order.

An array [T;N] is a statically-sized type (types.sized.static-size), regardless of N or T. T shall be a statically-sized type. The alignment requirement of [T;N] is the alignment requirement of T, and the size of [T;N] is N times the size of T.
A slice type, declared [T], is a special compound type, dependent on T. It has a statically unknown number of values of T laid out contiguously in increasing order.
A slice type [T], is a statically-unsized type (types.sized.static-unsize). T shall be a statically-sized type. The alignment requirement of [T] is the alignment requirement of T

The metadata of the slice type [T] is usize, regardless of T. The metadata value stores the number of elements of the slice. The size of a value of type [T], given the metadata value is N, is N times the size of T.
An array type [T;N] unsizes to the slice type [T] (exprs.unsize). The metadata for the coercion is the value N (exprs.unsize.metadata).
